title: Rangoli Chandel Slams Karan Johar, Alia Bhatt And Kareena For Discussing Marriage At MAMI 2019
text:
The 21st addition of MAMI Mumbai Film Festival was a grand star-studded affair. Most of the big names from the industry graced the occasion and discussions revolved around various subjects, including marriage.

“I'll be the happiest girl in the world,” that’s what Kareena Kapoor said in conversation with Karan Johar, when she was asked about Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor’s wedding and that has she even imagined that she would become Kareena’s sister-in-law one day.

This didn’t go down well with Kangana Ranaut’s sister Rangoli Chandel who has taken a dig at them all in the past as well. Taking to Twitter, she slammed them all for their discussions about marriage at MAMI 2019.

“MAMI ka closing discussion yeh tha ki Alia iss waqt ki sabse mahan kalakar hai, aur woh Kareena ji ki bhabi hai aur unki shaadi mein Karan ji pooja ka thaal lekar unka sawagat karenge, hmm achcha hai hum jaise gawar kya jane art ki baatein, humein toh kuch samajh aaya hi nahin,” she wrote.

MAMI ka closing discussion yeh tha ki Alia iss waqt ki sabse mahan kalakar hai, aur woh Kareena ji ki bhabi hai aur unki shaadi mein Karan ji pooja ka thaal lekar unka sawagat karenge, hmm achcha hai hum jaise gawar kya jane art ki baatein, humein toh kuch samajh aaya hi nahin 🙏 — Rangoli Chandel (@Rangoli_A) October 14, 2019

To Kareena’s comment, at MAMI Movie Mela 2019, Alia added, “Honestly I never thought about it but I don't want to think about it now also. We will cross that bridge when we come to it.”

Karan Johar said, "I do hope, eventually, whenever you do kind of get into that zone, you will actually handle and treat your career like Kareena has.”

Pehle award shows ko aur ab film festivals ko bhi kitty party bana diya 😂😂😂 https://t.co/ZftGQNwuNE — Rangoli Chandel (@Rangoli_A) October 14, 2019

To which, Alia said the way Kareena handled her career after marriage was a big learning. "She has genuinely been an inspiration to me. Earlier there was this thing that if an actress gets married, her career slows down a bit but she totally broke that for all of us," she added.

Kareena and Alia will be seen in Takht, which is to be directed by Karan Johar.
